par.text: Chlorine occurs naturally only in the combined state. Its most common compound is sodium chloride - NaCl. This is found in in seawater, which also contains chlorides of other metals such as potassium and magnesium. Sodium chloride is found in deposits that remain in the place of former seas. Chlorine ranks 17th in abundance, making up 0.013% of the Earth's crust by weight.
